pullRequest.body:
From my PhD (LeanCamCombi)

Co-authored-by: Kexing Ying <kexing.ying@epfl.ch>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [x] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #21001

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f9e2e991b2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21051/commits/f9e2e991b2d14be3fa5ce15b78e7c9715d7488ae)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.CondVar` (new file)|2001|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ condVar`
`+ condVar_ae_eq_condExp_sq_sub_sq_condExp`
`+ condVar_ae_le_condExp_sq`
`+ condVar_bot`
`+ condVar_bot'`
`+ condVar_bot_ae_eq`
`+ condVar_congr_ae`
`+ condVar_const`
`+ condVar_neg`
`+ condVar_of_aestronglyMeasurable`
`+ condVar_of_not_integrable`
`+ condVar_of_not_le`
`+ condVar_of_not_sigmaFinite`
`+ condVar_of_sigmaFinite`
`+ condVar_of_stronglyMeasurable`
`+ condVar_smul`
`+ condVar_zero`
`+ integrable_condVar`
`+ integral_condVar_add_variance_condExp`
`+ setIntegral_condVar`
`+ stronglyMeasurable_condVar`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21001~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Can you show that the conditional variance equals the variance if the RV and sigma algebra are independent? Should be easy to prove with [condExp_indep_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Probability/ConditionalExpectation.html#MeasureTheory.condExp_indep_eq)

May I suggest we wait on a later PR for that? It doesn't seem so easy, and would pull in a dependency on #20814:
```
attribute [fun_prop] StronglyMeasurable StronglyMeasurable.pow StronglyMeasurable.sub

/-- If `m, m'` are independent Ïƒ-algebras and `X` is `m'`-measurable, then `Var[f | m] = Var[f]`
almost surely. -/
lemma condVar_of_indep (hm' : m' â‰¤ mâ‚€) [hÎ¼m : SigmaFinite (Î¼.trim hm)]
    (hX : StronglyMeasurable[m'] X) (hmm' : Indep m' m Î¼) :
    Var[X ; Î¼ | m] =á¶ [ae Î¼] fun Ï‰ â†¦ Var[X ; Î¼] := by
  refine (condExp_indep_eq hm' _ (by fun_prop) -- `fun_prop` doesn't know that `Î¼[X ; m]` is `m'`-measurable
    hmm').trans sorry -- This `sorry` is a result from #20814
```

Do you really need those? Ideally we would interact with `condExp` as exclusively as possible, and relegate `condExpL2`, `condExpL1` and `condExpL1CLM` to the role of intermediate objects in the construction of `condExp`. I know that sometimes they are useful and do things that `condExp` can't, but let's invoque them only when necessary.
No, I was just copy-pasting the `condExp` API
Sorry, my comment was not clear: I was suggesting you delete those two results, on the basis that we don't want to use the condExp variants outside of the condExp constructions, unless necessary.
No it was clear. I have deleted them
You mean that you deleted them in a commit that you have not pushed yet? I still see the lemmas in the PR.
Hmm okay, apparently they were not deleted
Please add a notation `Var[X | m]` for the `MeasureSpace` case.

Readers who don't know the current ecosystem of repositories will have no idea of what this is referring to. Presumably you'll add that to Mathlib in a not too distant future anyway.
```suggestion
Define the Lebesgue conditional variance.
```
I think it's useful for people to know that this is being worked on, to avoid duplicating effort. I've linked to the repo
That docstring should be adapted to the variance case.

```suggestion
lemma condVar_ae_eq_condExp_sq_sub_sq_condExp (hm : m â‰¤ mâ‚€) [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] (hX : Memâ„’p X 2 Î¼) :
```
?
I don't really like that because `^ 2` is postfix, but I guess the current name is a bit silly

pullRequest.title: feat: conditional variance
